column4: does ubuntu use the older version of the debian installer than debian testing
i get a red screen that says no network card found
does ubuntu use an older version of the debian installer than debian sarge installer rc2
in warty, yes
seeing as warty was released considerably earlier than rc2
are you using the hoary installer?
what network card?
can you send that information plus the output of 'cut -f1,2 /proc/bus/pci/devices' in a bug report, please?
oh, hmm
that's probably not so much a matter of newness as the fact that we run at a higher debconf priority to reduce the number of questions.
try booting in expert mode, see what you get
I've already put that option back in Hoary
there was some ... debate between me and my boss about what the partitioner options should look like in warty :)
switch to tty2, modprobe the thing you need?
did you try expert mode, like I suggested?

in response to your earlier question about what version of the sarge installer ours is based on, it's not possible to give an answer to that; debian-installer is made up of lots of packages, and we merge them gradually and semi-independently
warty is roughly somewhere around rc1 with some later bits
modprobe <whatever-module-you-need>
are you reading what I'm saying?
there's support for isa devices, but it's not well-tested, largely because not many of the developers have any any more
it's probably a relatively small change to fix your case though
which is why I asked if you could please file a bug so it ends up on my to-do list
